definition: to be delirious/to be mentally confused
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Severe cases may progress to confusion and coma.
sentences.chinese: 情况严重的会进一步恶化以致昏迷及神志不清。

sentences.english: Upon entering the construction, visitors have reported feeling dizzy and disorientated.
sentences.chinese: 据进入房间的参观者说，在里面感觉眩晕和神志不清。

sentences.english: They found the man turning from side to side on his bed, still unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现那人在床上翻来复去，仍然神志不清。

sentences.english: He was unconscious for quite a long time after being admitted to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他被接受住院后好长一段时间都神志不清。

sentences.english: Mrs. Cheng really got worried then, because she thought her maid was delirious.
sentences.chinese: 程夫人觉得有点担心，她想她的丫环肯定是神志不清。

sentences.english: A person may become unconscious, not knowing what is happening.
sentences.chinese: 此时人会变得神志不清，对周围发生的事情毫无知觉。
他喝酒喝得神志不清了。

sentences.english: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.
sentences.chinese: 爱情并不完全让人神志不清，但它却有很多相同之处。
但是你毫无准备，而且母亲已神志不清。

sentences.english: Mary's mother was unconscious for five hours after being admitted to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽的妈妈被接收住院之后五个小时都神志不清。

sentences.english: He seemed to be swimming away from himself with great strokes, and hurriedly left the building.
sentences.chinese: 他感到中风似的神志不清了，匆匆忙地离开了大楼。

sentences.english: Marius had not even seen him.
sentences.chinese: 神志不清的马吕斯甚至全不曾察觉到他。

sentences.english: The poor man killed himself while he was of unsound mind.
sentences.chinese: 那可怜人在神志不清时自杀了。

definition: to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to be in a state of delirium
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
